answerText: interplanetary dust [prompt on partial answer of "dust", do not accept "interstellar medium"][10] A major source of interplanetary dust are the short-period varieties of these objects, agglomerations of rock, ice, and dust that leave behind trails.
heading: MAGNI |2011 | 1 | 5 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Unlike its primordial and interstellar counterparts, this material originates mostly from asteroid collisions and similar processes. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this material pervading the solar system, which gives rise to the zodiacal light when the light from the sun is scattered through it.
